structural_unit_name.en: School of Economics and Business Administration

description.en: The course includes introduction of the School of Economics and Business Administration, overview of the curricula and regulation of the studies. Students get knowledge and experience on how to use UT IT-systems and academic databases as well as requirements for written papers and proper citing.
description.et: Aine raames tutvustatakse teaduskonna struktuuri, õppetöö korraldust ja reegleid. Üliõpilased saavad teadmisi ja oskusi Tartu Ülikooli infosüsteemide ja teaduskirjanduse andmebaaside kasutamise, kirjalike töödele esitatud nõuete ning korrektse viitamise kohta.

objectives.en: The purpose of the course is to introduce general studies practices at the School of Economics and Business Administration, study regulations, access to IT systems and scientific databases. APA requirements for written papers are introduced and practiced.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on tutvustada TÜ majandusteaduskonda, õppetöö korraldust ja õppetööga seonduvaid nõudeid ja reegleid ning ligipääsu IT süsteemidele, õppe- ja teaduskirjanduse andmebaasidele. Antakse ülevaade kirjalike tööde vormistamisele esitatavatest nõuetest ja üliõpilased saavad esmased kogemused nende rakendamisel.

learning_outcomes.en: - know the structure of the curricula and are familiar with organisation and regulation of studies;
learning_outcomes.et: - teavad õppekava ülesehitust ning tunnevad õppetöö korraldust ja reegleid;

learning_outcomes.en: - know where and from whom to find information and support related to studies;
learning_outcomes.et: - teavad, kust ja kellelt õpingutega seonduvat infot ja tuge leida;

learning_outcomes.en: - know how to use different IT systems and study and research related databases;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskavad kasutada erinevaid õppimiseks vajalikke IT-süsteeme, õppe- ja teaduskirjanduse andmebaase;

learning_outcomes.en: - know the requirements for written papers in the School of Economics and Business Administration and can format them correctly;
learning_outcomes.et: - teavad, millistele nõuetele peavad vastama TÜ majandusteaduskonna üliõpilastööd ning oskavad neid korrektselt vormistada;

learning_outcomes.en: - can cite the sources properly and avoid plagiarism;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskavad kasutatud allikatele korrektselt viidata ning vältida plagiaati;

learning_outcomes.en: - acquire supporting knowledge that is helpful in studies (e.g. use of artificial intelligence).
learning_outcomes.et: - omandavad toetavaid teadmisi, mis on abistavad õpingutel (nt tehisintellekti kasutamine).

notes.et: All study materials and more thorough information about the course is in Moodle.

independent_work.et:
5 Moodle tests
The attendance/practical session tasks

description.et: 5 Moodle tests - Multiple-choice questions. To pass the test you need to answer 90% of the questions correctly.
The attendance/practical session tasks. The guidelines will be provided in practical sessions and in Moodle.

grade_preconditions.et: Attendance in lectures, seminars and practice learnings  75%

grade_evaluation.et: Final assessment in the form of pass/fail. To pass the cource the participant needs to pass all required tasks in Moodle environment.

arvestatud.et: All tests and practical tasks have been completed with a positive result

mittearvestatud.et: At least one of the evaluated tasks has not been completed with a positive result

debt_elimination.et: Retaking the test or redoing the attendance/practical task during the current semester, in accordance with the instructions given by the lecturer.

name.en: Chair of Public Economics and Policy
Centre for Academic Writing and Communication

description.et: Course outline information. Meeting with the Programme Director - general information about the School of Economics and Business Administration and general studies regulations and practices. (Diana Eerma, Kerli Ploom) (2 hours)

How to study at university? - Sharing knowledge and experience (tutors and fellow students). 
Practicing how to access study information system (SIS), find and register to courses in English, getting to know e-learning environment Moodle. (guests, Kerli Ploom) (2 hours)
Academic articles and other study materials: why, where and how. (Kerli Ploom) (2 hours)
Academic databases available at the UT Library - hand on practice. (Kerli Ploom) (2 hours)
Guest Lecturer - Academic writing in general and different forms of it. (Djuddah Leijen) (4 hours)
Formatting of written assignments in APA. Practical work - Citing and referencing (Kerli Ploom) (3 hours)
Formatting of written assignments in APA. General formatting, tables and figures (Kerli Ploom) (2 hours)
